column1: CITATION develop a nonparametric Bayesian model of name structure using adaptor grammars
We ran the Stanford Named Entity Recognition system CITATION to obtain a set of 25
column2: 000 candidate mentions which the system judged to be names of people

column1: Typical NER systems do not attempt to discover the internal structure of names or a database of canonical names
column2: although they often use prefabricated gazetteers of names and name parts as features to improve performance (CITATION; CITATION)

column1: We do not undertake the problem of named entity recognition (Tjong Kim CITATION)
column2: but rather apply an existing NER system as a preprocessing step CITATION

column1: CITATION shows that it is possible to learn a model of name structure
column2: either by using coreference information as labeled data
column3: or by leveraging a small set of hand-crafted constraints

column1: Data Evaluation was performed on a corpus of blogs describing United States politics in 2008 CITATION
